block.p: Carin Anne Christman, a daughter of Susan Christman and Lt. Gen. Daniel William Christman of West Point, N.Y., was married there yesterday to Michael Tad Carithers, the son of Nancy C. Carithers of Atlanta and Michael R. Carithers of Moultrie, Ga. The Rev. Ronald Fritz, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony at the West Point Cadet Chapel.

Mr. and Mrs. Carithers received law degrees from the University of Virginia, where they met. They are lawyers in Atlanta. The bride, 28, is an associate at Alston & Bird, and the bridegroom, 31, is an associate at Kilpatrick Stockton.

Carin Anne Christman, a daughter of Susan Christman and Lt. Gen. Daniel William Christman of West Point, N.Y., was married there yesterday to Michael Tad Carithers, the son of Nancy C. Carithers of Atlanta and Michael R. Carithers of Moultrie, Ga. The Rev. Ronald Fritz, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony at the West Point Cadet Chapel.

Mr. and Mrs. Carithers received law degrees from the University of Virginia, where they met. They are lawyers in Atlanta. The bride, 28, is an associate at Alston & Bird, and the bridegroom, 31, is an associate at Kilpatrick Stockton.

Mrs. Carithers graduated from Princeton University. Her father is the superintendent of the United States Military Academy at West Point, and in 1993 and 1994 he was the United States military representative to the North Atlantic Treaty Organization in Brussels.

Mr. Carithers, who is known as Tad, graduated from the University of Georgia. His father is the vice president for Southeast sales at Riverside Manufacturing, a uniforms manufacturer in Moultrie. His mother is a freelance technical writer.
